clinical_study.brief_title: Limited Access Protocol for the Use of Oral Cisapride
clinical_study.official_title: Limited Access, Open-label, Compassionate Use of Cisapride in the Treatment of Gastroparesis

brief_summary.textblock: Due to the lack of other drugs to treat gastroparesis Janssen and FDA approved the compassionate use of cisapride to treat patients who had no other effective therapy. For this observational study, 3 patients who had already been prescribed cisapride by outside physicians, were followed to determine the effectiveness of cisapride on their gastric emtpying.

primary_outcome.measure: Improvement in gastric emptying via self-report
primary_outcome.description: Patients were asked at clinical appointments about problems and improvement with gastric emptying.

study_pop.textblock: The subjects of the study were diagonosed with gastroparesis that was not being adequately treated.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of gastroparesis.
Exclusion Criteria:
- No diagnosis of gastroparesis.
